item.title: Your First Look at Planet Coaster 2 Achievements and How to Unlock Them
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/planet-coaster-2-achievements-unlock-them/

If you’re as excited as I am about Planet Coaster 2, then you’ll likely want to check out the achievements coming to the creative park building and management game. There aren’t too many, but enough to challenge you and keep you working toward a goal beyond the most beautiful park imaginable.

All Planet Coaster 2 Achievements and How to Unlock Each

The clear majority of Planet Coaster 2 achievements revolve around progressing through the game’s story mode, completing various challenges, and exploring the game’s core mechanics. They don’t appear overly tricky to unlock, so I’m confident you can 100% the game this year.

Is There a Planet Coaster 2 Platinum Trophy on PS5?

As Planet Coaster 2 launches simultaneously on PC and PlayStation 5, along with the Xbox Series X|S, it does indeed have a platinum trophy to unlock. It’s called “Heir to the Throne,” and of course, requires you to unlock all other trophies in the game to acquire.

It’s quite the challenge, but savvy fans with experience in previous “Planet” titles should have no issue meeting the unlock requirements for each of the above-mentioned Planet Coaster 2 achievements and trophies!

Don’t forget to show off your park in our community forums! We love to see screenshots of your latest gaming sessions!

Did you know Insider Gaming recently sat down with Hannah Telle on her return as Max in Life is Strange: Double Exposure? It’s an interview worth checking out before you leave!

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Has Already Earned Over $12 Million
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-tcg-pocket-has-already-earned-over-12-million/

Pokemon TCG (Trading Card Game) Pocket is off to a solid start, raking in over $12 million within 4 days of release. 

According to data provided by AppMagic (via mobilegamer.biz), Pokemon TCG Pocket earned $3 million per day during the opening weekend, accumulating a sum of $12 million within just four days. The game was released on the iOS App Store and Android Play Store on October 30, and since then, it has amassed over 10 million downloads globally. 

Pokemon TCG Pocket is an application that allows you to enjoy your card-collecting and trading passion digitally. The game is available in 89 countries worldwide, allowing players to open packs, collect cards, battle other players, and more. The collection features nostalgic illustrations as well as some completely new ones that have been specifically designed for the game. 

Players can open two booster packs for free each day; they also have the option to showcase their collections in files and boards to share them with the world. A new Pokemon card experience has been designed explicitly for TCG Pocket, which features ‘Immersive Cards’ with three-dimensional illustrations. Lastly, it features battles that are easy to understand and don’t take too long. 

In other news, check out how to get ‘Flair’ in Pokemon Pocket TCG. Also, Game Freak leaks revealed an ‘adult’ Pokemon movie and a new anime in production. What are your thoughts on Pokemon TCG Pocket earning over $12 million in the first four days of release? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about the Nintendo Switch 2 being on course for an announcement before April 2025. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Interview – Maximum Football Wants To Fill The Void For Players
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/interview-maximum-football-wants-to-fill-the-void-for-players/

Maximum Football is a game years in the making from Maximum Entertainment. As the game heads into early access, Insider Gaming Senior Editor Mike Straw caught up with Game Director Micah Brown to talk all things Maximum Football.

In this nearly 30-minute talk, Straw and Brown talk about the state of the game, the decision behind pricing, future plans and updates, its console release, getting Madden fans to try it, and much more.

You can watch the interview in full down below. Time stamps are also provided if you’d like to skip directly to a specific topic. And don’t forget to subscribe to Insider Gaming on YouTube.

  • 0:00 – Intro
  • 0:22 – How are you feeling about the state of the game?
  • 1:25 – What has the development experience been like?
  • 3:40 – Feedback from Steam Next Fest Demo
  • 5:19 – How much time went into getting animations done?
  • 7:58 – Dealing with the comparisons to Madden NFL and potential criticism?
  • 10:37 – How do you appeal to Madden players and those skeptical?
  • 11:36 – Having both college and pro rules and leagues in Maximum Football
  • 13:19 – What went into deciding on the pricing model?
  • 15:40 – What didn’t get in for early access?
  • 18:35 – Schedule for Maximum Football Early Access Updates?
  • 19:40 – How long will Maximum Football stay in Early Access and when will a console release happen?
  • 20:28 – Canadian rules?
  • 21:27 – Not having College Football competition on PC?
  • 22:25 – Maximum Football feature Micah Brown is most excited about?
  • 24:59 – How have things changed over the years?

For more Insider Gaming, check out our sit down with the actress behind Max Caulfield in Life is Strange, Hannah Telle. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Best Pack in Pokémon TCG Pocket to Open Right Now
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-pack-in-pokemon-tcg-pocket-to-open-right-now/

The Pokémon TCG Pocket mobile title has a few different packs to choose from at different stages of the game. If you’ve just started Pokémon Pocket, or you’re deeper in and seeking wisdom on which to rip open, we’ve got everything you need to know.

I find opening packs in Pokémon TCG Pocket as addictive as doing it in real life. The hope of pulling an Ultra Rare or Full Illustration card is too tempting, even though I know it’s going to be another duplicate Psyduck or Slowpoke. Still, the feeling is there, and if you don’t want to splash out your hard-earned money on physical packs, Pokémon TCG Pocket is the perfect fix for this itch.

Pokémon TCG Pocket’s early days feature three distinct packs (and starter packs) and it’s understandable if you want advice on opening the best packs.

Best Starter Pack in Pokémon TCG Pocket

I recommend opening the Charizard Pack when you first start Pokémon TCG Pocket as the Exeguttor EX in it is an extremely strong card and can be a consistent menace in online PvP. Additionally, I also think the Charmander Full Art card is the best-looking card of the six from a purely aesthetic standpoint—but each to their own.

The Charizard, Mewtwo, and Pikachu packs you’re offered aren’t for decoration—each one comes with a special set of two cards guaranteed to drop.

Here’s a quick look at each pack and what they offer you.

Best Pack to Open in Pokémon TCG Pocket

The Mewtwo Packs are the best to open in Pokémon TCG Pocket as they are the gateway to some of the most powerful cards in Pokémon Pocket—including Mewtwo itself.

In Pokémon TCG Pocket’s early weeks, Mewtwo EX is considered one of the strongest—if not the strongest—cards in the whole game. The Mewtwo pack also has other dominant cards including Venusaur EX and Dragonite. You only need to take a cursory glance at the bubble that pops up over each of the packs to see certain cards are exclusive to those packs.

Charizard packs also feature quite a few special EX cards: Charizard, Moltres, and Starmie. Outside of these, don’t sleep on Vileplume’s Soothing Scent attack which does high damage and puts opponents to sleep, or Alakazam’s Psychic move. On the other hand, the Pikachu pack-specific cards are decent, but won’t get you meta-decks like Charizard and Mewtwo do.

I highly recommend switching up the packs you open as it’s essential to get every card in the set without having to spend Card Points and buying them individually. Not only this, but when the meta does change, you have more cards to choose from, and you can also build diverse decks needed for unique challenges in Pokémon Pocket.

We also have advice on how to get Flair in Pokémon TCG Pocket—as well as what it does—and we know the latest on a leaked “Adult Pokémon movie,” and Miraibo GO—a Pokémon GO clone.

item.title: Best ASG-89 Loadout in Black Ops 6: Attachments, Perks & Equipment
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-asg-89-loadout-in-black-ops-6-attachments-perks-and-equipment/

Black Ops 6 has some great close-range options for smaller maps like Nuketown and Stakeout, but none are quite as powerful as Shotguns. The ASG-89 is the fastest-firing Shotgun in the game, but you’ll need the best attachments for it to experience its true power.

With that said, here’s the best loadout for the ASG-89 in Black Ops 6.

  • Best attachments
  • Best Perks, Wildcard & Equipment
  • Best Secondary for ASG-89
  • How to unlock ASG-89
  • Is the ASG-89 any good in Black Ops 6?
  • Best alternatives

Best ASG-89 loadout attachments in Black Ops 6

  • Barrel: Long Barrel
  • Magazine: Fast Mag I
  • Rear Grip: CQB Grip
  • Underbarrel: Balanced Stock
  • Fire Mods: Rapid Fire

Kicking off our best ASG-89 loadout in Black Ops 6 is the Long Barrel, which improves the Shotgun’s damage range, which is pretty poor otherwise. Then, the Fast Mag I provides a quicker reload at the expense of some bullets, while the CQB Grip gives you some dive, slide, and sprint to fire speed to get your shots off faster while being mobile.

The Balanced Stock further boosts mobility, improving strafing, hipfire, movement, and aim walking movement speeds. Lastly, to ensure you’re finishing enemies as quickly as possible, the Rapid Fire attachment is essential for increasing the Shotgun’s fire rate.

Best Perks, Wildcard & Equipment for ASG-89

  • Perk 1: Gung-Ho
  • Perk 2: Assassin
  • Perk 3: Double Time
  • Perk 4: Dexterity
  • Wildcard: Perk Greed
  • Lethal: Semtex
  • Tactical: Stim Shot
  • Field Upgrade: Spring Mine

We’re focussing on mobility with the ASG-89 so that you can get up close and personal effortlessly and put enemies to bed. Gung-Ho improves movement speed while reloading and using Equipment, while Assassin lets you track enemies on a KIllstreak for more intel on the opposition’s position.

Double Time boosts Tac-Sprint so you can reach top speed for longer, and thanks to the Perk Greed Wild Card, we’ve gone with Dexterity for our fourth Perk, which reduces weapon motion when jumping, sliding, and diving, as well as decreasing fall damage.

As for Equipment, we like a Semtex for the quick throw and detention time, while the Stim Shot keeps you topped up on health to stay in the fight. Finally, the Spring Mine is a top choice for a Shotgun loadout, as you’ll want to protect your flank while behind enemy lines.

Best Secondary for ASG-89

The Grekhova is the best Secondary for the ASG-89 in Black Ops 6, as it’s fully automatic, so when you need to hit the target and finish a kill off, the fast fire rate gives you plenty of leeway to do so.

How to unlock ASG-89 in Black Ops 6

To unlock the ASG-89 you’ll need to hit Level 31 in Black Ops 6. This can be done in Multiplayer or Zombies, and using our best tips to level up fast, you should make it there fairly quickly.

Be sure to take advantage of Double XP weekends and playlists like Nuketown 24/7, as those will help net you a load of XP.

Is the ASG-89 any good in Black Ops 6?

The ASG-89 is very good for small maps, but it isn’t so great outside of close quarters. So, we recommend either running it as a secondary with an Overkill class or only using it when you play a small map like the ones found on Face Off Moshpit.

Best alternatives to the ASG-89 in Black Ops 6

As the only other Shotgun in Black Ops 6, the Marine SP is a great alternative to use while you wait to unlock the ASG-89. Another great close-range weapon is the Kompakt 92, an extremely fast-firing SMG that can shred enemies with a rapid TTK.

For more Black Ops 6 guides, check out when Ranked Play is coming to the game and sign up for the Insider Gaming weekly newsletter to stay updated.
